summary: This document is a credit card statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account holder named Glenda Anderson-Layne, covering the billing period from January 11, 2019, to February 11, 2019. It shows transactions, payments, and account details, but contains no direct references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or related criminal activities. This document is a credit card statement for a Navy Federal Credit Union Visa Signature card belonging to Glenda Anderson-Layne, covering transactions from January to March 2019. It details purchases, payments, interest charges, and account terms, and includes a change of address form. It appears to be a financial record from the Epstein case document set, possibly related to tracking expenditures or financial activity of an individual connected to the case. This document is a credit card statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account belonging to Glenda Anderson-Layne, showing transactions, payments, and account details for the billing cycle ending April 11, 2019. It includes billing rights information and transaction details, some of which are to Groupon. This document is a credit card statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account holder named Glenda Anderson-Layne, covering transactions from March to April 2019. It shows numerous purchases, including a significant payment to the law firm Tully Rinckey PLLC. The statement details billing rights, interest calculations, and payment information. This document is a credit card statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account holder named Glenda Anderson-Layne, covering the billing cycle ending June 11, 2019. It details transactions from April to May 2019, including purchases, payments, and interest calculations. The document is part of the Epstein case data set, suggesting it may be a financial record subpoenaed or entered into evidence. This document is a credit card statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account holder named Glenda Anderson-Layne, covering transactions from May to July 2019. It details purchases, payments, interest charges, and account terms, and appears to be part of financial records related to the Epstein case. This document is a credit card statement from Navy Federal Credit Union for an account holder named Glenda Anderson-Layne, covering transactions from June to August 2019. It details purchases, payments, interest charges, and account terms, and appears to be part of financial records related to the Epstein case.
